column4: I have issues with sound, once had it all working now dont.  any clues as to troubleshooting alsa?  I can get an output from speakers with the esd command.
you -can- or you -can't- get any sound output?
you -can- or you -can't- get any sound output?
just test sound from esd.  Looking for troubleshooting pointers really, have got stuff to work on my other mandrake system fine and this worked when I first installed it.
cat /proc/asound/cards . Paste output in #flood
so sound -does- work, just not through esd?
I dont have the names of the tools to play with setup.  cant even find a /etc/init.d/   command to properly start the esd daemon
is System> Preferences> Sound> Enable sound server startup checked?
yep
are you using mplayer -ao esd
dpkg -l mplayer\*|grep ^ii
and your cpu is...?
amd sempron
64-bit?
do you think I should uninstall and reinstall the 386 one?  No just 32bit
if you're using the 32-bit version, you should be able to use mplayer-k6
thanks for that, I hadnt even heard of it!
what do you mean race?
imagine the situation where you can't verify su hasn't been compromised
granted, a rather corner case, but that's one of the reasons sudo exists
ok
of course root login would need to be enabled to allow su  eg. ubuntu
